t: Proverbs 18
One*pn who isolates himself pursues selfish desires; he*ln rebels against all sound wisdom.
A*pn fool does not delight in understanding, but*ln only wants to show off his opinions.
When*pn a wicked person comes, contempt also comes, and*ln along with dishonor, derision.
The*pn words of a person’s mouth are deep waters, a*ln flowing river, a fountain of wisdom.
It*pn is not good to show partiality to the guilty, denying*ln an innocent person justice.
A*pn fool’s lips lead to strife, and*ln his mouth provokes a beating.
A*pn fool’s mouth is his devastation, and*ln his lips are a trap for his life.
A*pn gossip’s words are like choice food that*ln goes down to one’s innermost being.
The*pn one who is lazy in his work is*ln brother to a vandal.
The*pn name of the Lord*s is a strong tower; the*ln righteous run to it and are protected.
The*pn wealth of the rich is his fortified city; in*ln his imagination it is like a high wall.
Before*pn his downfall a person’s heart is proud, but*ln humility comes before honor.
The*pn one who gives an answer before he listens — this*ln is foolishness and disgrace for him.
A*pn person’s spirit can endure sickness, but*ln who can survive a broken spirit?
The*pn mind of the discerning acquires knowledge, and*ln the ear of the wise seeks it.
A*pn person’s gift opens doors for him and*ln brings him before the great.
The*pn first to state his case seems right until*ln another comes and cross-examines him.
Casting*pn the lot ends quarrels and*ln separates powerful opponents.
An*pn offended brother is harder to reach than*ln a fortified city, and*ln quarrels are like the bars of a fortress.
From*pn the fruit of a person’s mouth his stomach is satisfied; he*ln is filled with the product of his lips.
Death*pn and life are in the power of the tongue, and*ln those who love it will eat its fruit.
A*pn man who finds a wife finds a good thing and*ln obtains favor from the Lord.*s
The*pn poor person pleads, but*ln the rich one answers roughly.
One*pn with many friends may be harmed, but*ln there is a friend who stays closer than a brother.
